subject: Skiing
Ski Jumping
World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: Janne Ahonen of Finland became the first ski jumper to win the prestigious Four Hills tournament for a fifth time.Ahonen, 30, won the final stop in rainy conditions in Bischofshofen, Austria, with jumps of 126 and 136 meters, earning him 251.6 points in the World Cup event.His main competitor, Thomas Morgenstern of Austria, finished third with 242.7 points. Ahonen also won the Four Hills tournament in 1999, 2003 and 2005. In 2006, he shared the victory with Jakub Janda of the Czech Republic.
